content: st single_crochet in 10 sts 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in 17 sts 48 sts  row 7 - 8 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each st across 48 sts  row 9 chain 1 turn single_crochet in 14 sts *single_crochet 2 sts together* 4 times single_crochet in next 4 sts *single_crochet 2 sts together* 4 times single_crochet in 14 sts 40 single_crochet  row 10 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each st across 40 single_crochet  row 11 this row will join the top section to begin working from row to rounds for the bottom half depending on how you overlap the stitches you will either have the right side overlapping the left or the left side overlapping the right  the picture on the left shows the left side overlapping the right if the fabric is turned right side up insert the hook through the last stitch worked on row 10 to the second stitch worked on row 10 and join with a single_crochet single_crochet in each of the next 36 sts then join stich 38 to stitch 1 with a single_crochet join to the first single_crochet and proceed to the bottom portion 38sts the picture on the right shows the right side overlapping the left if the piece is turned right side up overlap the last two stitches worked on row 10 over the 1st two stitches worked on row 10 and single_crochet these stitches together single_crochet in each remaining stitch around join to the first single_crochet and proceed to the bottom portion 38 sts directions for the bottom portion variation 1 option 1 white top the word row is used but it means round for this portion bottom portion is worked from the right side and doesn t need to be turned at the end of each round  row 12 chain 3 double_crochet in next st chain 2 skp 2 sts *double_crochet in each of next 2 sts chain 2 skp 2 sts* around join to beginning chain 3  row 13 chain 1 single_crochet in first two double_crochet sts chain 2 *single_crochet in each of next 2 double_crochet sts chain 2* around join to beginning single_crochet repeat row 12 and 13 to desired length end with a row 12 fasten_off sew snap at ribbed section at the neckline option 2 yellow top this is the same stitch pattern but gives a slightly smaller hole  row 12 chain 3 double_crochet in next st chain 1 skp 1 sts *double_crochet in each of next 2 sts chain 1 skp 1 st* around join to beginning chain 3  row 13 chain 1 single_crochet in first two double_crochet sts chain 1 *single_crochet in each of next 2 double_crochet sts chain 1* around join to beginning single_crochet repeat row 12 and 13 to desired length end with a row 12 fasten_off sew snap at ribbed section at the neckline directions for bottom portion variation 2 - worked in v_stitch for this portion row means round bottom
